Author: bkrausz
Content: I can see this filling the same niche as software to run ASP on Linix (well, at least the way I use the software): some consulting company that does mostly OSS wants to attract MS-based clients. The cheapest thing to do is to just run the .Net software on a nix box and say "hey, we host .Net apps!" rather than finding or becoming an experienced Windows sysadmin...many hosting companies offer ASP on the nix boxes for that exact reason: to appeal to a larger market.

Author: bkrausz
Content: I hope to see this idea take off, it's a great addition to current Web 2.0 technologies, but I highly doubt this will see the adoption rate necessary to make implementing it useful.  It's the issue of "it needs to be implemented for people to adopt it, and people need to adopt it for it to be worth implementing" conundrum.
